I'm a total noob, and had the same problems everyone else was having. Follow these steps and it should work fine. I first created two folders on my desktop, one for the game, and one for the cracks. I then extracted the game to the game folder, and the cracks to the crack folder. Then I ran the setup that is in the game folder. After it installed, I moved the two cracks from the crack folder to "The Creative Assembly" folder found in Program Files (x86). Inside this folder, there is a folder that says Rome - Total War. Select both cracks and move them into this folder. You will be asked if you want to replace the files that are in the folder. Select yes. I tried running the game without replacing these files and I got the same "missing disk" message a lot of U R getting. After I replaced the existing files, the game runs fine. BTW, I'm running Windows 7. Great download, props anton13. Will seed for a long time.

I figured out a fix for the Barbarian invasion 'select item from list' message. What you need to do is download the following torrent:

http://thepiratebay.org/torrent/4171388/Rome_Total_War_%28including_Barbarian_Invasion__amp__Alexander%29

No need to reinstall the original rome total war or even the barbarian invasion, but you can install the alexander expansion if you want to complete the set. What you need to do to get BI working is take the Barbarian invasion file from the cracks folder, and replace the barbarian invasion file in the installation directory. For some reason this worked for me.

Thank you, thank you, thank you! Used soco316's (pg 2) installation instructions and it was easy as pie, no ISO mounting required, worked like a charm and I was playing right away. PROTIP: This may be helpful if you've never played this game before- you can't save your game until you've finished the prologue/tutorial section, the "save game" button will be grayed out. I thought it had something to do with this dl but no, it is the way the game was made so don't start playing until you can commit about an hour or so, otherwise you won't be able to save your progress.
